title: Isipathana prevail in thriller to retain title
byline: It was near yet so far for Trinity as defending champions Isipathana dashed their hopes of clinching the Dialog Schools Knockout Rugby title with a last-minute try scored in the last minute of the second session to come out victorious by 12 points to 9 in the final played at the Royal Sports Complex ground.

title: Economic stability in region, for countries like SL, dependent on security - Indian High Commissioner
byline: In the wake of Operation Sindoor, Indian High Commissioner Santosh Jha, in an interview with Daily Mirror, said that economic stability in the region, especially for countries like Sri Lanka, is dependent on security.

title: CSE boosted by massive gains as global economic tensions ease
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its bullish momentum, recording substantial volumes and turnover as the market closed above the 16,300 mark.

title: Tough airport security prompts smugglers to use Indo-Ceylon ferry service for drug trafficking – Agencies
byline: Strict security facilities currently in place at the country’s main international airports sponsored by local law enforcement agencies, seemed to have prompted the smugglers to change their modus operandi and resort to trafficking narcotics through Indo-Ceylon ferry service, as officials busted a massive Rs.41.2 million worth Kush case yesterday, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Over 15,000 MT of salt washed away by rain in Puttalam
byline: While the authorities are struggling to cope with a huge salt shortage in the country more than 15,000 metric tons of harvested salt intended for collection have been washed away due to sudden heavy rains, according to salt producers in Puttalam.

title: Ex-air stewardess from south London arrested in Sri Lanka over £1.5m cocaine haul
byline: A 21-year-old former cabin crew member from south London has been arrested in Sri Lanka after allegedly attempting to smuggle £1.5 million worth of cannabis into the country.

title: Joe Biden diagnosed with ’aggressive’ prostate cancer
byline: Former US President Joe Biden, 82, has been diagnosed with prostate cancer that has spread to his bones, a statement from his office said on Sunday.

title: BASL raises alarm over online attack on judicial officers
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has expressed deep concern over a surge in online content, including social media posts, that it says unfairly targets judicial officers and threatens the integrity of the justice system.

title: Troop of monkeys invade Wildlife DG’s residence
byline: A troop of monkeys have reportedly been causing disturbances at the residence of the Acting Director General of the Department of Wildlife Conservation (DWC), located in the Kaduwela area.

title: Shots fired at shop in Dehiwala
byline: Two unidentified men on a motorcycle opened fire at a shop in the Nedimala area of Dehiwala, Police said.

title: Mahindananda remanded
byline: Former Minister of Agriculture Mahindananda Aluthgamage was remanded till May 26 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali over allegations of causing a loss of over Rs. 13 million to the government by importing a shipment of organic fertilizer contaminated with harmful bacteria and pathogens.

title: Milan Jayatilleke arrested
byline: Gampaha District Chief Organiser of the Mawbima Janata Party Milan Jayatilleke has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Police arrest gunman who chased, killed youth in Mt. Lavinia
byline: The Mount Lavinia Divisional Crime Investigation Bureau has arrested the gunman involved in the recent fatal shooting in Mount Lavinia.

title: UNP, SJB agree on administering local bodies together with other Opposition parties
byline: The United National Party (UNP) and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) have reached an agreement to work together and administer local bodies in which the Opposition commands a majority.

title: Mahindananda appears before court
byline: Former Agriculture Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage appeared before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court this morning, following the issuance of a warrant for his arrest.

title: Romania’s pro-EU candidate beats hard-right rival to win presidential election
byline: Romania’s pro-European Union presidential candidate Nicușor Dan won the country’s presidential election Sunday, defeating his ultranationalist rival.

title: Chamara Sampath granted bail
byline: Badulla District Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been released on bail by the Badulla Magistrate’s Court in connection with a case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over the alleged misuse of state funds.

title: Defending champions India pull out of 2025 Asia Cup
byline: There’s a big question mark over this year’s Men’s Asia Cup in September with a report claiming that the Indian cricket team has withdrawn from the biennial continental tournament. The BCCI has reportedly told the Asian Cricket Council (ACC), which is headed by Pakistan minister Mohsin Naqvi, that it’s pulling out its teams from the Women’s Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Sri Lanka slated to be held in June and the Men’s Asia Cup 2025.

title: Thai youth from Bangkok with Rs.79 Mn worth Kush nabbed at BIA
byline: A 21-year-old Thai youth arriving from Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia was detained by Sri Lanka Customs for attempting to smuggle in ’Kush’ Cannabis worth over Rs. 79 million through the Bandaranaike International Airport last night.

title: NMRA CEO Saveen Semage resigns
byline: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA), Dr. Saveen Semage has tendered his resignation, effective Saturday (17).

title: Over 100mm rainfall expected over next few days
byline: Rainfall exceeding 100 mm is likely in several parts of the country as the South-West monsoon conditions gradually establish over Sri Lanka, the Department of Meteorology forecast today.

title: Milan Jayatilleke granted bail
byline: Gampaha District Chief Organiser of the Mawbima Janata Party, Milan Jayatilleke, who was arrested today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, was released on bail of Rs. 1 million by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.
